titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Lord Durham dined quietly with us before the meeting in the Town Hall.

The Hall was crowded. Colonel Blackitt spoke dully and too long. Then Lord Durham followed: and then I came, & Rogerson. The wetness of the weather may have been the cause of a certain flatness & depression, which hung over the proceedings.
